intro: Moquilea tachirensis, commonly known as the Tachira moquilea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, specifically Venezuela. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
